April 2022 County of Marin EMS PM 1
PEDIATRIC SHOCK
Indications
• Inadequate organ and tissue perfusion to meet metabolic demands as seen in the following
signs and symptoms: pale, cool, clammy and/or mottled skin, ALOC, SBP <70mmHg
ALS RMC
IV/IO x2
Hypovolemic, Septic,
Cardiogenic Shock
or Spinal Shock
☎
• PHYSICIAN CONSULT
Control hemorrhage, if
for treatment orders •
appropriate
If HR <60
• NS fluid bolus
• Go to Pediatric Bradycardia, PC 3 • 3-5kg: 10ml/kg IV/IO
• ≥6kg: 20ml/kg IV/IO
• Reassess frequently
• Repeat as needed
If HR >220 (infant), >180 (child)
• Go to Pediatric Tachycardia Poor
Perfusion, PC 4
• Check blood glucose and treat if <60mg/dl
(<40 mg/dl for neonate)
• 3-7kg: D10W 2ml/kg IV/IO over 10 min
• ≥8kg: D10W 5ml/kg IV/IO over 10 min
• Max dose: 125ml
CRITICAL INFORMATION
If unable to establish vascular access
• Shock in children may be subtle and
• Glucagon 0.03 mg/kg IM
hard to recognize
• MR x2 q15 min
• BP may be difficult to obtain and
• Max dose: 1mg
readings may be inaccurate
• Initiate early transport and treat
enroute, if appropriate
• Neonates 0-28 days of age with shock
If symptoms of anaphylaxis
should be transported to MarinHealth
Medical Center • Go to Allergic Reaction Policy, PM 2
